p: The actions identified in this literature review are a good starting point for evaluating the stage of OH development in different settings, such as research or policy development. Moreover, the knowledge gaps identified were (1) for the general operationalization of OH: comparing the number of resources needed for OH coordination and actions, with the benefit obtained from those; and (2) for the inclusion of the environment in OH actions: the understanding of disease ecologies within the context of environmental factors (e.g. weather parameters, sewage surveillance, pathogens transmission through aerosols, environmental hygiene and sanitization measures).
